intro: Lavenia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved lavenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. Lavenia macrophylla is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
